    • Constructor Detail

      • InvToSEED

        public InvToSEED(java.lang.String h,
                 java.lang.String loc,
                 java.lang.String cutoff,
                 boolean lOnly,
                 boolean save)
        Creates a new instance of InvToSEED for a single location
        Parameters:
        h - The host of the MySQL database
        loc - The station or location name
        cutoff - Do not create epochs before this date
        lOnly - Creat last epoch only
        save - If true, run the saveseed bash script after creating the seedfile

      • InvToSEED

        public InvToSEED(java.lang.String h,
                 java.lang.String file,
                 java.lang.String loc,
                 java.lang.String cutoff,
                 boolean lOnly,
                 boolean save)
        Creates a new instance of InvToSEED for a single location
        Parameters:
        h - The host of the MySQL database
        file - The filename of the seed file base (.seed, .its, .xml will be added
        loc - The station or location name
        cutoff - Do not create epochs before this date
        lOnly - Creat last epoch only
        save - If true, run the saveseed bash script after creating the seedfile

      • InvToSEED

        public InvToSEED(java.lang.String h,
                 java.lang.String file,
                 java.lang.String loc,
                 java.lang.String cutoff,
                 boolean lOnly,
                 boolean save,
                 java.io.File output)
        Creates a new instance of InvToSEED for a single location
        Parameters:
        h - The host of the MySQL database
        file - The filename of the seed file base (.seed, .its, .xml will be added
        loc - The station or location name
        cutoff - Do not create epochs before this date
        lOnly - Creat last epoch only
        save - If true, run the saveseed bash script after creating the seedfile
        output - A File object pointing to the desired output directory

      • InvToSEED

        public InvToSEED(java.lang.String h,
                 java.lang.String file,
                 java.lang.String loc,
                 java.lang.String cutoff,
                 boolean lOnly,
                 boolean save,
                 java.io.File output,
                 boolean startThread)
        Creates a new instance of InvToSEED for a single location
        Parameters:
        h - The host of the MySQL database, this can be hostname:catalog if inv is not the catalog
        file - The filename of the seed file base (.seed, .its, .xml will be added
        loc - The station or location name
        cutoff - Do not create epochs before this date
        lOnly - Create last epoch only
        save - If true, run the saveseed bash script after creating the seedfile
        output - A File object pointing to the desired output directory
        startThread - Actually start executing the thread now, if false, the user will need to start the thread later (no doshape or saveseed)

    • Method Detail

      • errorPrint

        public static void errorPrint(java.lang.Throwable t,
                              java.lang.String msg)
        given an Exception and local message string, dump the exception and system state at the time of the exception. This routine should be called by all "catch(Exception) clauses to implement standard reporting.
        Parameters:
        t - The Exception
        msg - The user supplied text to add

      • prta

        public static void prta(java.lang.String txt)
        prta adds time stamp to output of prt(). takes the input text and prints it out. It might go into the MSDOS window or to the SESSION.OUT file depending on the state of the debug flag. The "main" should decide on debug or not, set the flag and then all of the output will be available on the window or in the file. The file is really useful when something does not work because the user can e-mail it to us and a full debug listing is available for postmortem
        Parameters:
        txt - The output text

      • prt

        public static void prt(java.lang.String txt)
        prt takes the input text and prints it out. It might go into the MSDOS window or to the SESSION.OUT file depending on the state of the debug flag. The "main" should decide on debug or not, set the flag and then all of the output will be available on the window or in the file. The file is really useful when something does not work because the user can e-mail it to us and a full debug listing is available for postmortem
        Parameters:
        txt - The output text

        catalog - The catalog name for this inv instance

      • run

        public void run()
        create XML file - most of what is needed to create a XML file is here. We put it in a Thread in case we ever wanted to overlap creations.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
